content.description: Twenty members of an athletic club are studying the relationship between the time it takes an individual athlete to reach a given level of fatigue during exercise (time to fatigue, measured in minutes) and athletic performance. For each member, time to fatigue and a performance score were recorded. The computer output of the regression analysis is shown in the table.
content.question: Term <math alttext="coefficient" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mtext>Coef</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="standard error of the coefficient" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mtext>SE Coef</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mtext>T</mtext></mstyle></mrow></math> Constant 39.88 4.24 9.41 Time to fatigue 3.92 0.71 5.52 Which of the following is a 90 percent confidence interval for the slope of the regression line relating performance score and time to fatigue? Assume that the conditions for inference are met.

choices.label: <math alttext="3.92 plus or minus 1.645 times 0.71" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.92</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.645</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.71</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="3.92 plus or minus 1.729 times 0.71" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.92</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.729</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.71</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="3.92 plus or minus 1.734 times 0.71" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.92</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.734</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.71</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="39.88 plus or minus 1.729 times 4.24" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>39.88</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.729</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>4.24</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="39.88 plus or minus 1.734 times 4.24" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>39.88</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.734</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>4.24</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3.92 plus or minus 1.734 times 0.71" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.92</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.734</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.71</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 9.2: Confidence Intervals for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
